Module guigame
Package guigame.logic.players

Class Players

java.lang.Object
guigame.logic.players.Players
public class Players
extends java.lang.Object
Represents two players. They have an initial y-offset for the GUI.
See Also:
getPlayersArray()

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private Player[] players
    Contains both players
    private int y
    The initial y-offset (for both players the same), should be almost centered

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Players​(int y)
    Create a new Players-object with one human and an initial y-offset (for GUI).
    Players​(int humans, int y)
    Create a new Players-object with a number of humans and an initial y-offset (for GUI).

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Player[] getPlayersArray()  
    void setPlayer​(int index, boolean human)
    Change the player type at some index.
    void setPlayers​(int nrOfHumans)
    Set nr of human players.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • players

      private final Player[] players
      Contains both players

    • y

      private final int y
      The initial y-offset (for both players the same), should be almost centered

  • Constructor Details

    • Players

      public Players​(int y)
      Create a new Players-object with one human and an initial y-offset (for GUI).
      Parameters:
      y - The y-offset for both players, where they are spawned
      See Also:
      Players(int, int)

    • Players

      public Players​(int humans, int y)
      Create a new Players-object with a number of humans and an initial y-offset (for GUI).
      Parameters:
      humans - Nr of humans to generate, (2 - humans) AI players will be generated
      y - The y-offset for both players, where they are spawned
      See Also:
      Players(int)

  • Method Details

    • getPlayersArray

      public Player[] getPlayersArray()
      Returns:
      Both players in a Player-Array

    • setPlayers

      public void setPlayers​(int nrOfHumans)
      Set nr of human players.

      Leaves the first player as AI. Set the second player as human if

      Parameters:
      nrOfHumans - is equal to 1.

    • setPlayer

      public void setPlayer​(int index, boolean human)
      Change the player type at some index. Should NOT be used with index=0 and human=true
      Parameters:
      index - The index at which player will be changed
      human - Whether the generated Player should be a HumanPlayer (true) or AI-Player (false)
